title: How to Create a Paper Plate Tambourine

steps.headline: Start with an ordinary paper plate.It's recommended to use the smaller size plate.
steps.description: A styrofoam or plastic plate will work as well. You also may want to double the plate, if you prefer a stronger or heavier tambourine.

steps.headline: Use a standard paper puncher to punch holes around the edge of the plate.
steps.description: Holes should be evenly spaced, roughly one inch apart. If you do not have paper punchers, you can punch the plates with a needle and widen the hole with a toothpick (if needed).

steps.headline: Take a colorful length of yarn or thread and begin to loop-stitch around the edge of the plate.
steps.description: It is helpful to smudge some glue on the leading tip of the yarn. When the tip dries, it is stiff and is easier to thread through the holes.

steps.headline: Add the bells.
steps.description: Between each stitch, insert a jingle bell.

steps.headline: Continue stitching the edge of plate with a bell on each loop.
steps.description: You may skip every other loop if you want to save on the amount of jingle bells used.

steps.headline: Finish plate by decorating with glue, glitter, sequins, colored paper, crayons, markers and paint.
steps.description: Add extra strands of yarn or ribbon to create a fringe.

tyn: Optional: paint, markers, crayons, glitter, sequins
